SGCCRfC Wiki

Finite Element Method (FEM)

The Finite Element Method is a powerful numerical method used to approximate solutions to PDEs in engineering, physics, geophysics, and structural mechanics.

ðŸ§© Core Concepts

  • Mesh generation (triangles, tetrahedra, quads, hex)
  • Shape functions
  • Weak formulation of PDEs
  • Assembly of stiffness matrices
  • Boundary conditions (Dirichlet, Neumann)
  • Time integration schemes

ðŸ”§ Open-Source FEM Libraries

FEniCS

Automated finite element computations.
ðŸ”— https://fenicsproject.org

deal.II

High-performance C++ FEM.
ðŸ”— https://www.dealii.org

ElmerFEM

Multiphysics simulation.
ðŸ”— https://github.com/ElmerCSC/elmerfem

CalculiX

Structural FEM solver.
ðŸ”— http://www.calculix.de

MOOSE Framework

Multiphysics FE-based solver.
ðŸ”— https://github.com/idaholab/moose
